info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 5:30PM EDT until August 07 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Madison County in northwestern Virginia... Central Orange County in central Virginia... Northeastern Albemarle County in central Virginia... Southeastern Greene County in central Virginia... South central Culpeper County in northern Virginia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 530 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Stanardsville, or 10 miles northeast of Charlottesville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Orange, Hollymead, Gordonsville, Ruckersville, Eheart, Rapidan, Barboursville, Everona, Stony Point, Montpelier Station, Madison Run, Newtown, Nasons, Madison Mills, Montford, Lahore, Old Somerset, Advance Mills, Unionville and Somerset. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
